column4: i'm convinced there's a firewall of some kind running on my 6.10 because port forwarding is working to other machines in the office but not to this server, regardless of what service is running.
alternately every service on my machine is only listening to loopback.  how can i check to see which case is the problem?
configure each service one by one, there is no default fire wall installed in desktop edition
- i've been trying for the last 4 hours.  i can access apache and ssh locally but i can't from the outside world.  can you help me a bit?
I am pretty much sure that , 6.10 desktop edition do not have a firewall installed out of box
- it's server version, if that matters.
- i did.  then i posted the output ("droyer 12310 " etc)
hmm, then you should study your services. Sorry I never installed server version. I am using a desktop version for a server :)
- by study my services you mean check my config files?
- i'm reading online and apparently iptables is running?  again, not sure how to check.  i'm very n00b
it is a program for inspecting services. try to enable the repos
